title: Infinitives With Or Without To Exercise

questions.question: Need I ..................... the washing up?
questions.description: When need is used as a modal auxiliary verb, it is followed by infinitive with to.

questions.question: You had better ....................... her what she wants.
questions.description: Had better is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: He began ......................... up off the floor.
questions.description: The infinitive is usually used with the marker to.

questions.question: Do I need ......................... any longer?
questions.description: When need is used as an ordinary verb, it is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: Need I ........................... for the drinks?
questions.description: When need is used as a modal auxiliary verb, it is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: I don't let my children ............................ up very late.
questions.description: Let is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: They made the child .............................. the milk.
questions.description: Made is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: We both heard him ...................... that he was quitting.
questions.description: Hear is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: Could you help me ............................ this radio?
questions.description: Help can be followed by an infinitive with or without to.

questions.question: She was heard ............................ that she was disappointed.
questions.description: In passive structures, hear is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: Did you feel the ground .............................?
questions.description: Feel is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: He was made ........................ back the money.
questions.description: Made is followed by an infinitive with to in passive structures.
